name: firebase-jest-testing
description: Tools for testing Firebase back-end features, using Jest.

scripts.ci: firebase emulators:exec --config sample/firebase.json --only firestore,functions 'npm run _init && npm run _ci_main && npm run _ci_fns'
scripts.ci:main: firebase emulators:exec --config sample/firebase.json --only firestore,functions 'npm run _init && npm run _ci_main'
scripts.start: concurrently -n emul,init "firebase emulators:start --config sample/firebase.json --only functions,firestore" "npm run _start_2"

--experimental-vm-modules: Needed for now (Aug 2020), to use native ES6 modules with Jest
--detectOpenHandles speeds up tests: This is weird, but consistent. If we keep it in 'npm test', the test execution is ~2x faster (as reported, per test).
Doing this, since it means our timeouts can be smaller.
peerDependencies: Force the downstream project to explicitly depend on 'firebase'. It would be wrong that we bring all that in.
However, use of '@firebase/testing' is seen as an implementation detail they should not worry about.

devDependencies.jest: It's a development dependency. The published code is not Jest specific; only our samples are.

start: Must use 'firebase emulators:start' so that the Emulators UI shows the data. This causes 'concurrently'
and 'wait-on' to be needed, as dependencies.
Update: Since 'firebase-tools' 8.7.0, the '--ui' parameter is there, but we're already used to this.
